Author: polyfractal
Content: hm a last minute GDS art addition is now triggering MT.1  ("min. metaltop width : 0.44¬µm") and MT.2a ("min. metaltop spacing : 0.46¬µm")  DRC errors. Any ideas or try regenerating with a slightly different size?

Author: _luke_w_
Content: Yeah I just had the same thing because a hole in the metal generated by the image script left two corners touching

Author: _luke_w_
Content: I just opened it up in klayout and squished the hole, hopefully that fixes it

Author: _luke_w_
Content: (apparently `klayout -e` is the magic flag required to actually let you edit anything)

Author: greg.hashtag.9468
Content: It's in and passed the current pre-check üëç

Author: polyfractal
Content: yeah that looks like my issues. i'm not great with klayout, how did you close the hole? Just draw a new polygon to fill it, or did you edit the existing polygon?

Author: greg.hashtag.9468
Content:
The script used for the waferspace logo does a DRC check. But doesn't grep/show errors the DRC found. You have to dig into the .xml report, and look under the <items> tree
So I had a similar issue on my logo art

Author: polyfractal
Content: aha, that's good to know for a faster check. cheers!

Author: _luke_w_
Content: ah. I saw it ran a DRC in the Makefile, didn't see that it didn't propagate an exit code üòÖ  thanks Greg

Author: mole99
Content: Btw. you can load the DRC results using the Marker Browser in KLayout.

Author: _luke_w_
Content: I used the "partial" tool to drag over the edge on the left hand side of the hole until it met the right hand side
